title: Kinetic energy - relative to people throwing ball

content.question: Two people are throwing a ball back and forth. At the instant shown in the figure, Person <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is not moving relative to the ground, the ball is moving horizontally to the right, and Person <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is running to the left. Which of the following claims about the kinetic energy of the ball is correct?

choices.label: The kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is the same as the kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>.

The kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is greater than the kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>.

The kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is less than the kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>.

The kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is positive and the kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is negative.

content.answer: The kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is less than the kinetic energy of the ball relative to Person <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
